Summary: Orange illuminated object travelling slowly to the south.
divs: sighting detailsat approximately 11:46 pm on saturday night 06\27\09, my wife and i left our house in order to reset her mom���s vcr \ tv after a power outage caused by a storm. we all tend to stay up late on weekends, and we wanted to get this done to have sunday free. as we drove west on interstate 70, and approached the i-435 interchange, i noticed a strange orange light low in the sky, to the south of i-70, and west of i-435. my wife asked if i saw the light in the sky, and i said i did. it was about the same color orange as the streetlights commonly used in metropolitan areas. later, my wife commented that it seemed more white at first, but i did not notice this. we kept watching it as we got onto i-435 and proceeded south. the light seemed to be moving southward slowly. i tried to pull over to the side of the highway to get a better look, but was unable to do so due to traffic. i was finally able to pull over somewhere between 51st st and 350 highway. i grabbed my binoculars to get a closer look as my wife tried to get a photo. unfortunately, she wasn���t able to get a photo. i did get a pretty good look at the source of the light through the binoculars. it seemed to be almost a shield shape with a long spire pointing downward. it was a bright orange color, but not at all blinding. the long point seemed to be moving from left to right as if the object\craft\device was slowly rotating on its vertical axis. i was able to observe it for approximately 10 ���12 seconds, then it just faded out. it did not click off suddenly ��� like someone turning off a light ��� but more like someone used a dimmer switch, and went from bright to black in approximately 3 ��� 4 seconds. we watched for a couple minutes, then started southward again. we saw the object one more time as we approached the vicinity of 87th st. it was much farther south, i would approximate roughly 8 miles or so. it almost appeared as if it had separated into three separate objects, but due to cloudy conditions, i cannot be entirely sure of this. when we first noticed it, it appeared to be 8 ��� 10 degrees above the horizon, and about the size of a small marble held at arm���s length. it did not change altitude significantly during the time we observed it, and did not exhibit any rapid maneuvers or changes in speed. it seemed to travel in a southerly direction, with no deviation in either speed or direction. i did not experience any feelings of fright, or anxiety, mostly it was wonder and fascination. i have included a photoshop rendering of what i observed as closely as i can remember it.
